> > > I actually implemented HyperNeat in Java about a year ago. (I had so=
me trouble understanding what to do with ANJI and JNEAT too.)
> > > 
> > > =
It was designed to be able to modify the number of hidden layers. It was my=
 first Java project and it was unnecessarily complicated. However, a large =
chunk of the code was ported from the original C++ HyperNeat. I'm sure it's=
 reusable with a bit tuning (e.g. not mutating number of layers and their c=
onnection patterns.)
